org.safs.selenium.rmi.agent

Interface SeleniumRMIAgent

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SeleniumAgent

    public interface SeleniumRMIAgent
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Defines a generic Selenium RMI Agent communicating with a Selenium RMI Server.

    A Selenium RMI Server is the centralized controller embedded within each remote Selenium Standalone Server. This provides an RMI gateway to the remote host machines running a Selenium Server allowing us to provide additional functional features on the machine hosting the browsers of a Selenium test.

    The Selenium RMI Agent is typically started automatically by SAFS/Selenium classes needing to communicate with the remote SAFS RMI Server.

    Note: For consistent operation the safs.server.hostname needs to be set in code or on the command line before launching an Agent connecting to a remote Selenium RMI Server:

    • In Code:

        System.setProperty("safs.server.hostname", "<rmi server ip>");

        System.setProperty("safs.server.hostname", "hostname.company.internal.net");

    • Command line:

        -Dsafs.server.hostname=<rmi server ip>

        -Dsafs.server.hostname=hostname.company.internal.net
    See Also:
    SeleniumServerRunner, SeleniumRMIServer, SeleniumServer

    • Method Detail

      • ping

        void ping()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by an RMI Server. A simple RUThere call. The server will generally receive a ConnectException thrown by RMI if the Agent cannot be called because it has gone away.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAgentID

        java.rmi.server.ObjID getAgentID()
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by an RMI Server. Returns an ObjID to uniquely identify the RMI Agent.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAgentName

        java.lang.String getAgentName()
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by an RMI Server. Returns the name or remoteType of the RMI Agent.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called by an RMI Server. The RMI Server will instruct the Agent to shutdown when the Server itself is being shutdown or finalized. The Agent does not have to unRegister from the Server in this case because the Server will already be disconnecting from the Agent.

        The Agent should accept the shutdown request and initiate a new shutdown Thread so that the call to shutdown from the Server can immediately return.

        The Agent might normally reset itself to an idle state where it is polling once again for the existence of another RMI Server.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • runCommand

        java.lang.Object runCommand(java.lang.Object command)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
        Called by an RMI Server. This is a "do anything" function that the Server and Clients have a private contract to implement. It essentially allows a Client/Server implementation to pass anything back and forth and act according to the shared design.

        For example, the Client and Server may have been coded to pass string commands back and forth and the string commands can be parsed to provide an unlimited number of command possibilities.

        Parameters:
        command - Object of a type expected by the Client implementation for this method.
        Returns:
        Object of a type expected by the Server implementation calling this method.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.lang.Exception
